On this page, you will find a short description of my research interestes, conference attendances as well as my full list of piblications. For a list of past scientific activites, please see my [CV](./curriculumvitae.pdf){target="_blank"}. My primary research interests is in infinite groups, their actions on spaces and their interplay with dynamical systems. Currently, I have been particularly interested in generalisations of the Higman-Thompson groups and their connections to shift dynamical systems. I am also interested in connections between group theory and theoretical computer science. In particular, decision problems in groups, cellular automata and groups generated by automata. ::: {.column-margin style="position: fixed;"} ::: {.quote-container} ::: {.stylized-quote} "He took his vorpal sword in hand:
Long time the manxome foe he sought–
So rested he by the Tumtum tree,
And stood awhile in thought." ::: {.quote-attribution} -- Lewis Carroll ::: ::: ::: ::: ## Funding information From February 2024 to January 2027 my research is funded by the *Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council Open postdoctoral fellowship "The Higman-Thompson groups, their generalisations, and automorphisms of shift spaces."* ## Publications ### Submitted
  1. Conjugacy for certain automorphisms of the one-sided shift via transducers.
    C. Bleak, F. Olukoya.
    *Preprint* [arXiv:2301.13570](https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.13570), 1-53.
  2. Automorphisms of shift spaces and the Higman--Thompson groups: the two-sided case.
    C. Bleak, P. Cameron, F. Olukoya.
    *Preprint* [arXiv:2006.01466](https://arxiv.org/abs/2006.01466), 1-46.
  3. Automorphisms of shift spaces and the Higman--Thompson groups: extensions.
    F. Olukoya.
    *Preprint* [arXiv:2407.18720](https://arxiv.org/abs/2407.18720), 1-50.
  4. An automata theoretic proof that $Out(T_2)$ is isomorphic to $\mathbb{Z}/ 2\mathbb{Z}$ and some embedding results for $Out(V)$.
    F. Olukoya.
    *Preprint*: [arXiv:2003.14372](https://arxiv.org/abs/2003.14372), 1-21.
  5. The core growth of strongly synchronizing transducers.
    F. Olukoya.
    *Preprint*: [arXiv:2004.00516](https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.00516), 1-12.
### Published
  1. Automorphisms of the generalized Thompson's group.
    F. Olukoya.
    *Trans. London Math. Soc.*, **9**, (2022), 86-135.
    [doi:10.1112/tlm3.12044](https://doi.org/10.1112/tlm3.12044) and [arXiv:1908.03816](https://arxiv.org/abs/1908.03816).
  2. Automorphisms of shift spaces and the Higman--Thompson groups: the one-sided case.
    C. Bleak, P. Cameron, F. Olukoya.
    *Discrete Analysis* 2021:15, 35pp.
    [doi:10.19086/da.28243](https://doi.org/10.19086/da.28243) and [arXiv:2004.08478](https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.08478).
  3. Automorphism tower of groups of homeomorphism of Cantor space.
    F. Olukoya.
    *Israel Journal of Mathematics* Vol. **244**, 883–899 (2021).
    [doi:10.1007/s11856-021-2196-z]( https://doi.org/10.1007/s11856-021-2196-z) and [arXiv:1908.03815](https://arxiv.org/abs/1908.03815).
  4. Conjugate subgroups and overgroups of $V_n$.
    C. Donoven, and F. Olukoya.
    *International Journal of Algebra and Computation* Vol. **30**, No. 6 (2020) 1129--1160.
    [doi:10.1142/S0218196720500344](https://doi.org/10.1142/S0218196720500344) and [arXiv:1710.00913](https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.00913).
  5. The growth rate of automata groups generated by reset automata.
    F. Olukoya.
    *To appear, Groups Geometry and Dynamics* 1-37.
    [arXiv:1709.07209](https://arxiv.org/abs/1709.07209).
  6. The further chameleon groups of Richard Thompson and Graham Higman: automorphisms via dynamics for the Higman groups $G_{n,r}$.
    *To appear, Memoirs of the AMS*, 1-96.
    C. Bleak, P. Cameron, Y. Maissel, A. Navas, F. Olukoya.
    [arXiv:1605.09302](https://arxiv.org/abs/1605.09302).
## Past conference attendances * _75th British Mathematical Colloquium_, University of Manchester, Manchester, United Kingdom: 17-20 June 2024. * University of Glasgow, Glasgow, United Kingom: 13-16 May 2024. * *GoTh Workshop: Groups of Thompson and their relatives*, University of Magdeburg, Magdeburg, Germany: 18-22 September 2023 * *World of Group Craft*, online, 26 August 2021. * University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia: 30 March 2021. * *Symmetry in Newcastle*, University of Newcastle, Newcastle, Australia: 2 October 2020. * *Geometric and Asymptotic Group Theory with Applications (GAGTA) 2020 one day workshop*, online: 23 June 2020. * University of St Andrews, St Andrews, United Kingdom: 23 June 2020. * *Groups generalisations and Applications*, University of Aberdeen, Aberdeen, United Kingdom: 16 January 2019. * École Normale Supérieure, Paris, France, 4-8 December 2017.
